intro: Minuartia sandwithii, commonly known as the Sandwith's rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has small, linear leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or white flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
